homeHeader.title: From Documents to Live Store—Launch Your Online Business in the UAE with Ease
homeHeader.description: Struggling with complex documentation, multiple approvals, and constantly changing e-commerce regulations? At One Nexuz, our experts streamline all the paperwork, from government submissions to approvals, so you can focus on growing your online store, not chasing paperwork. Tap into a 2.2B+ online consumer base, reduce your time-to-market, and discover lucrative marketplace opportunities with an e-commerce license in the UAE.

faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What is an e-commerce license in the UAE?
items.answer: An e-commerce license legally allows you to operate an online business in the UAE, sell products or services, and comply with federal and local regulations.

items.question: Do I need a physical office to get an e-commerce license?
items.answer: No, many free zones allow e-commerce businesses to operate without a physical office, although mainland businesses may have different requirements.

items.question: How long does it take to get an e-commerce license?
items.answer: With proper documentation and expert support, the process typically takes 7–21 business days, depending on the jurisdiction and business activity.

items.question: Can foreigners own 100% of a UAE e-commerce business?
items.answer: Yes, certain UAE free zones allow 100% foreign ownership. Mainland businesses may require a local sponsor, depending on the activity.

items.question: Which activities can I legally operate under an e-commerce license?
items.answer: Licensed activities include online retail of goods, digital products, marketplaces, e-services, subscriptions, dropshipping, and import/export of products.
